titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL379_02
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL379_02

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

div.tei:ab:

Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[ysrm | yhnʿm | w-bn-hw | šmr | yhrʿš | mlky | sbʾ | w-ḏ-rydn | ... ... | w-ndb | w-hqšb | ... ... | gnʾ] | w-ṣwbt | w-mḥfdt | hgr-hm[w] 2.[hkrm | w-hdbw-hw | w-brʾ | w-ḥẓyn | mbrʾ ... ... mbrʾm | ḥśśm | w-ʾbnm | ....m | w-wśf]w | w-rymw | kl | gnʾ-h[w] | w-ṣwbt- 3.[hw | w-mḥfdt-hw | ḏ-ṯny | sqfyn | w-ḏ-sqfm | b-ʿ... ...gnʾ-hw | w-ṣwbt-hw | w-mḥfdt-hw | bn | mrym]-hw | ʿdy | ṯrt-hw | w-hdbw-hw | w-hʿqbn 4.[gnʾm | qšbm | w-hmrw-hw | w-šrʿw-hw | ḫṭln | ... ...ḫdʿw | w-hʿqbw | l-ḫlf-hw | mṣrʿtm | mbrʾ | w-]mqyḥ | kl | ṣdqm | bn | mwṯrm | ʿdy | t= 5.[frʿm | b-mlʾ | ʿšrt | ymtm | bn | wrḫn | ḏ-mbkrn | ... ...b-mqm | mrʾ-hmw | ʿṯtr-šrqn | w-ʾšms-hmw | w-]ʾlʾlt-hmw | w-b-ʾḫyl | w-mqymt | ḫmys 6.[ḏ-rydn | w-hrṯdw | hgr-hmw | hkrm | b-tḥ... ... | b-wrḫn | ḏ-qyẓn | ḏ-b-ḫrfn | ḏ-l-sṯt | w-ṯsʿy] | w-ṯlṯ | mʾtm | bn | ḫrf | mbḥḍ | bn | ʾbḥḍ

ḏ-rydn w-hrṯdw hgr-hmw hkrm b-tḥ b-wrḫn ḏ-qyẓn ḏ-b-ḫrfn ḏ-l-sṯt w-ṯsʿy w-ṯlṯ mʾtm bn ḫrf mbḥḍ bn ʾbḥḍ

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.and the glacis and the towers of their town 2.and built high its wall and its glacis 3.its [...] to its foundation. And they constructed it and added 4.a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the 5.their (other) gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies 6.3[96] of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[Yāsirum Yuhanʿim and his on Shammar Yuharʿish, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān … … and constructed and built ... ... the wall] and the glacis and the towers of their town 2.[of Hakirum, and they built it and constructed and completed the construction … … a construction in mud-brick and in stone ... .... And they increas]ed and built high its wall and its glacis 3.[and its towers with two roofs and with a roof in … ... its wall and its glacis and its towers from] its [upper part] to its foundation. And they constructed it and added 4.[a new wall, and they provided it with an access route and they equipped it, (that is,) the ḫṭln-structure, ... ... they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction and] a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the 5.[the top-(this) in the space of ten days from the month of Dhū-Mubakkirān (i.e. May) ... ... by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar Shāriqān and their protective goddesses and] their (other) gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies 6.[of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … … in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān (i.e. June) of the year] 3[96] of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
and the glacis and the towers of their town
and built high its wall and its glacis
its ... to its foundation. And they constructed it and added
a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the
their other gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies
of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Yāsirum Yuhanʿim and his on Shammar Yuharʿish, the two kings of Sabaʾ and Dhū-Raydān … … and constructed and built the wall and the glacis and the towers of their town
of Hakirum, and they built it and constructed and completed the construction … … a construction in mud-brick and in stone . And they increased and built high its wall and its glacis
and its towers with two roofs and with a roof in … ... its wall and its glacis and its towers from its upper part to its foundation. And they constructed it and added
a new wall, and they provided it with an access route and they equipped it, that is, the ḫṭln-structure, they repaired and reinforced for its gate door-leaves and a construction and a completion with all accuracy, from the foundation to the
the top-this in the space of ten days from the month of Dhū-Mubakkirān i.e. May by the power of their lord, ʿAthtar Shāriqān and their protective goddesses and their other gods, and by the resources and the authority of the armies
of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … … in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān i.e. June of the year
of the Era of Mabḥaḍ bin ʾAbḥuḍ.

of Raydān. And they committed their town of Hakirum … … … in the month of Dhū-Qiyāẓān i.e. June of the year
